title: CH4 heating curve - more energy for vaporization

content.description: The following questions refer to the graph below, which shows the heating curve for methane, CH4.
content.question:
Which of the following best explains why more energy is required for the process occurring at 
110 K than for the process occurring at 90 K ?

choices.label: Intermolecular attractions are completely overcome during vaporization.
Intermolecular attractions in the solid phase are weaker than in the liquid phase.
Electron clouds of methane molecules are less polarizable at lower temperatures.
Vaporization involves a large increase in temperature.

content.answer: Intermolecular attractions are completely overcome during vaporization.
